Comments:
Classifier: Random Forest
-------------------------

Model parameters were fine-tuned using `RandomizedSearchCV`.

The best parameters were found to be:
{'n_estimators': 1000, 'min_samples_split': 2, 'min_samples_leaf': 10, 'min_impurity_decrease': 0.1, 'max_leaf_nodes': 280, 'max_features': 3, 'max_depth': 230, 'criterion': 'log_loss', 'class_weight': 'balanced'}

I used the precision as the score, and got the best score of RandomForestClassifier(class_weight='balanced', criterion='log_loss',
                       max_depth=230, max_features=3, max_leaf_nodes=280,
                       min_impurity_decrease=0.1, min_samples_leaf=10,
                       n_estimators=1000).

This classifier has less false-positives than before!

Contamination of:
	- current cuts = 0.29%
	- random forest = 0.91% [and 123% more signal events]
	- random forest + cuts (except containment) = 0.29% [and 97.7% more signal events]

Also, the transverse to muon momentum ratio had ~0 feature importance so it can either be transfroemd by a StandardScaler or be discarded from training data.
